snippets.script:
<script>
    import {Box} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Box palette="accent" contents={["mobile", "tablet"]}>
    I have no styling on Mobile / Tablet Viewports.
</Box>

<Box
    palette="affirmative"
    contents={["desktop", "widescreen"]}
>
    I have no styling on Desktop / Widescreen
    Viewports.
</Box>
snippets.title: Contents Preview

data.text: Contents NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.5.0. All Components have access to the data-contents global HTML attribute via the contents property which removes the Component's bounding box / stylings from the DOM tree. USAGE : REPL does not support viewport values, resize your Browser to observe this feature. NOTE : By passing an array, you can set responsive values . e.g. contents={["mobile", "tablet"]} <script> import {Box} from "@kahi-ui/framework"; </script> <Box palette="accent" contents={["mobile", "tablet"]}> I have no styling on Mobile / Tablet Viewports. </Box> <Box palette="affirmative" contents={["desktop", "widescreen"]} > I have no styling on Desktop / Widescreen Viewports. </Box>

*.name: contents
*.description: Alters the Component to removes bounding box / stylings from the Component, acting as a blank container for child content.

data.render:
NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.5.0.

All Components have access to the data-contents global HTML attribute via the contents property which removes the Component's bounding box / stylings from the DOM tree.

USAGE: REPL does not support viewport values, resize your Browser to observe this feature.

NOTE: By passing an array, you can set responsive values. e.g. contents={["mobile", "tablet"]}

<script>
    import {Box} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Box palette="accent" contents={["mobile", "tablet"]}>
    I have no styling on Mobile / Tablet Viewports.
</Box>

<Box
    palette="affirmative"
    contents={["desktop", "widescreen"]}
>
    I have no styling on Desktop / Widescreen
    Viewports.
</Box>
